To transfer your domain name away from OVH, please contact our customer service.
domain_configuration_protection_desactiv: Activating Domain Protection enables you to protect yourself against theft by forbidding all transfers.

Any company that sells domain names also offers incoming transfers, which involves repatriating a domain name managed by another registrar. The company requesting the transfer must ensure that the transaction has actually been requested by the owner.
If the checks are not carried out in sufficient depth, the domain can still be moved without the requestor’s identity being verified properly. The rightful owner could then lose management of their domain name as a result.
How does OVHcloud protect you from domain theft?

To protect you from theft, we move your domain into a state where no transfers can be made. If another domain name registrar requests a transfer, it is immediately blocked. No transfers can then be requested illegitimately.
If you later wish to transfer your domain name to another registrar, you will then have to disable domain protection.
Domain protection will be disabled. The transfer code will be available in a few minutes.
An error has occurred requesting to disable domain protection
domain_configuration_protection_activate: Are you sure you want to enable protection for your {{t0}} domain?
Activating Domain Protection enables you to protect yourself against theft by forbidding all transfers.

Any company that sells domain names also offers incoming transfers, which involves repatriating a domain name managed by another registrar. The company requesting the transfer must ensure that the transaction has actually been requested by the owner.
If the checks are not carried out in sufficient depth, the domain can still be moved without the requestor’s identity being verified properly. The rightful owner could then lose management of their domain name as a result.
How does OVHcloud protect you from domain theft?

To protect you from theft, we move your domain into a state where no transfers can be made. If another domain name registrar requests a transfer, it is immediately blocked. No transfers can then be requested illegitimately.
If you later wish to transfer your domain name to another registrar, you will then have to disable domain protection.

domain_configuration_whois_step1_questio: Please choose whether you would like your personal information to be displayed or hidden in the WHOIS directory for the {{t0}} domain
domain_configuration_whois_step1_helpwiz:
When you reserve a domain name, you will be asked to provide some personal details. These will be published in the public WHOIS database by default.
This feature allows you to hide this information if you want to.
WHOIS is a public service for searching information related to domain names and IP addresses. This database namely includes information on domain name holders.
What information is published in WHOIS?

The information published belongs to the domain name holder. The information published belongs to the domain name owner. The information depends on the domain name extension but generally it will include:
  • their address
  • their telephone and fax numbers
  • their email

You can hide or display each of the three types of information.
How does OVHcloud enable you to hide this information?

If you enable this service, OVHcloud replaces your personal information with generic information. However, you can still be reached by anyone wishing to contact you.
  • The address field is replaced by an address linked to OVHcloud, and we forward the emails received to the actual recipient.
  • The phone and fax fields are replaced by an OwO number.
  • The email field is replaced by a redirection that points to the owner's email address. This address is refreshed regularly and an anti-SPAM filter is applied.

domain_configuration_dns_entry_add_title: Add an entry to the DNS zone
domain_configuration_dns_entry_add_step1: Here's a quick description of the different types of entry that can be added to your DNS zone.
Allows a domain name or sub-domain to be linked to an IPv4 address.
Allows a domain name or sub-domain to be linked to an IPv6 address.
An alias for the A record, useful for finding out alternative names for a host's services.
Enables the distribution of keys that allow a mail server to verify DKIM signatures (useful in the fight against spam).
Specifies a geographic area associated with the domain name.
Specifies the mail server responsible for email distribution for a domain.
Allows the public services that you provide under a domain name to be specified.
Allows the authoritative servers for the zone to be declared.
Assures remote mail servers that your servers are fully authorised to send emails. Useful in the fight against spam.
Allows the server address to be specified tomorrow, as well as which port should be used for a specific service. It is an extended and more generic version of the MX record.
Allows public SSH keys to be listed in the DNS system, helping to verify the authenticity of the host machine.
Allows any text to be entered in the DNS zone.
